column4: so, typeahead in epiphany hasn't worked for me forever ... can anyone confirm having or not having this problem?
lots of firefox devotees here I suspect ;)
surely someone uses ephy! :)
I used to use galeon until Havoc and co took it out of gnome, effectively - so I'm a little biased against epiphany ;)
although it's a nice browser - I'm not trying to start a holy war ;-)
yeah, there are obviously pros and cons to both ephy and ff, which have been discussed ad hom. :)
the lack of configurability in epiph drives me nuts
what does ff allow you to configure that ephy doesnt?
if youu know a command to make it open tabs without popping in my face, I'm all ears
with galeon you did galeon --no-raise -n
don't get me wrong, when developing web apps I use ff for the extensions, but i personally prefer ephy for general browsing
as I said, it's nice enough  - but  a lot of galeon's options are missing
I like to open stuff from other apps in the bckground: afaik you can't do it with epiphany
I have to shunt the browser to another workspace to avoid it covering what I'm reading when it loads
you mean you click 'open link in new window'?
no, for example if I click an URL in an email. it pops up regardless of what options I enter (new tab or whatever)
well that's a metacity thing
the fix is in, but everyone has to fix their apps, which hasn't been completed yet so it's not going to make 2.10
no it isn't - with galeon you could do galeon --no-raise -n
you could specify that in gconf or whatever
that might have been a temp fix in galeon, but the proper solution is desktop-wide w/ metacity
you see my irritation though? Gnome needs to have a *few* configurable options that don't require workarounds
heh - actually I use fluxbox a lot because it obeys my changes- changing gnome has become awkward. i know the reasons - i just find some things illogical
